summary:
- It is Steve Merchant's birthday. They are going to have a cake and listen to some music on XFM 104.9. They talk about the fact that Steve is 27 today and Carl is 28.
- Leo Sayer tells XFM 104.9 that he advises the shorter man to wear a short jacket because it's an optical illusion. Then they talk about stripes and the shape of the jacket.
- Speaker A always looks forward to his father's gifts because they are remarkable. His father bought him the collected Wartime speeches of Sir Winst Churchill.
- Rick and Bess are talking about the VH1 Top 100 album. They think it's an arbitrary list because it started off with the Doors and then went to Lava Underground and then the biggest thing that year.
- Speaker B tells the audience that he went to the Monarch last night and got a discount for XFM DJs. He also agreed to DJ there with Ricky Gervais, but he can't remember if he signed something.
- Rick has been signed up to DJ Yes Club in Canada. He tells the story of how he got in for a quid off by grabbing the doorman off the queue.
- Jimmy Web and Steve Merchant are talking about their new station XFM 104.9. They are both a little bit hungover because they have been drinking a lot. They talk about their plans for the future.
- Speaker B tells Complain that he went out last night because it was his birthday. Then he asks why he didn't come out because it's his name all over the show.
- Rick and Carl are playing a game on the radio. They are trying to come up with dynamite stuff, but they are failing. They think the complete lack of professionalism on their part is unbelievable.
- Christian is giving away a trip to Salem, Massachusetts to Dwight Schultz, an actor best known for his role in the 80s TV show "Dwight Schultz". But they went to the Boris Karloff World of Terror because they were at someone's birthday.
